result.execSummary:
The defendant Monica D Curry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monica D Curry

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Monica D Curry in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO THE PENALTY ENHANCER:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered the penalty enhancer, 'USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON', stricken from the record.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served;  Huber privileges for work and child care.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR.
Conditions:
*  Commit no new violations;
*  Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment;
*  Submit a DNA sample and payd the DNA surcharge.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Monica D Curry in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective March 14, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michael Hanrahan - Branch 4 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Monica D Curry in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense has received discovery and request time to review with defendant.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Arnetta P.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Monica D Curry in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Monica D Curry in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Reserve, Br. 21.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
